intro: Schulzia compacta var. laciniata, commonly known as the serrated Schulzia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features small, delicate flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
